meanings.sent1: She is reenforcing the shelf with extra brackets.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers are reenforcing the foundation of the building.
meanings.sent3: The superhero reenforcing the city's defenses with her superpowers.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like reenforcing steel, unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement reenforced the student's confidence.

meanings.definition: To make stronger or more resilient
meanings.sent1: The vitamins reenforcing his immune system helped him recover quickly.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can reenforce your muscles and improve your health.
meanings.sent3: The knight's armor was reenforced with magical spells for extra protection.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve to succeed was reenforcing her spirit day by day.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them reenforced their bond through tough times.

meanings.definition: The act of providing additional support or strength
meanings.sent1: The reenforcing of the bridge ensured it could withstand heavy traffic.
meanings.sent2: The reenforcing of the policy was necessary to prevent misuse.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected reenforcing of the team by new members brought fresh ideas.
meanings.sent4: The reenforcing of the wall made it stand firm against the storm.
meanings.sent5: The reenforcing of the friendship with a heartfelt apology repaired the bond.
